sorular.soru: In which situation is the visually impaired person indicating that she is going to cross the road?

feedback.metin: A raised white stick with red rings indicates that a visually impaired person is going to cross. You are required to give way to these road users.

sorular.soru: Should you expect oncoming traffic on a motorway?

feedback.metin: Motorways have separate carriageways and uneven intersections. You should not expect oncoming traffic on motorways.

sorular.soru: You got into an accident with only minor collision damage. Where do you fill in the damage claim form?
cevaplar: At the scene of the accident itself.
You always do this at home, within 5 working days.
In a safe place such as a parking lot.
sorular.dogruCevap: In a safe place such as a parking lot.

feedback.metin: If you had an accident with only minor collision damage, do not stay at the scene of the accident to handle everything. This causes extra inconvenience and danger. With the other party, find a safe place such as a parking lot, and handle everything there. Together, fill in the front of the damage claim form, you should both sign it. After that, divide the damage claim form (one person keeps the original, the other the carbon copy). Of these, you fill in the back of the form at home as quickly as possible. You both send your own part to the insurance company. Do you fill in the damage claim form digitally? Then you also do this together. The app tells you how to do this.

sorular.soru: What lighting should the towed car use?

feedback.metin: If your car has to be towed due to a breakdown, turn on the hazard lights to warn the other traffic. You may use your hazard lights in case of imminent danger.

sorular.soru: Should you dim your front fog lights in case of oncoming traffic?

feedback.metin: Fog light at the front emits white or yellow light and the beam shines downwards obliquely. You cannot blind oncoming traffic with approved front fog lights and you are not required to dim them in case of oncoming traffic. Rear fog light shines directly to the rear. It blinds much faster and is therefore only allowed when visibility is less than 50 metres due to fog or snowfall.

sorular.soru: Can passengers be transported in a caravan while driving?
cevaplar: This is only allowed if seat belts are present.
Yes. This is allowed up to a maximum of 8 people.
No. No one may be transported in the caravan.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. No one may be transported in the caravan.

feedback.metin: Transporting passengers while driving in a caravan or trailer is prohibited.

sorular.soru: What is the minimum following distance at a speed of 100 km/h?

feedback.metin: No matter what speed you drive, you should always maintain a minimum following distance of 2 seconds in good road and weather conditions. At higher speeds, this is automatically a longer distance in metres, because you cover more metres per second. For example, at 100 km/h, you travel about 27.5 metres per second. So this is about 55 metres in 2 seconds. At 50 km/h, this is about 27.5 metres in 2 seconds.

sorular.soru: What is the meaning of this warning light?
cevaplar: The engine temperature is too high.
Windscreen washer fluid reservoir is empty.
The engine oil level is too low.
sorular.dogruCevap: The engine temperature is too high.

feedback.metin: This warning light indicates that the engine temperature is too high. This can mean that the coolant level is too low. This causes the engine to be cooled insufficiently. Stop immediately to rectify the problem. Continuing to drive can cause serious damage to your engine.

sorular.soru: Which lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: When visibility is reduced, for example in wooded areas, use dipped headlights. This will ensure other traffic can see you. Daytime running lights have this function too. However, the rear lights will not always turn on by default when daytime running lights are on, while dipped headlights will.

sorular.soru: Does a coachman fall under the category drivers?

feedback.metin: A coachman or someone pushing a handcart falls under the category drivers. Handlers of horses and livestock also fall under the category drivers.

sorular.soru: In which situation do you have to let the pedestrian go first?

feedback.metin: The stop sign means that the passenger car has to give priority to all drivers on the intersecting road. This does not say anything about pedestrians walking on the same road. The rule 'through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off' still stands. Because the pedestrian walks straight ahead and the passenger car turns off, the pedestrian can go first in both situations.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: The E-1 sign means you are not allowed to park on this side of the road. However, the sign underneath indicates that this only applies to lorries, so you may park here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to put a substance on your number plate that prevents you from being documented by automatic speed-control systems?

feedback.metin: Making a number plate unrecognisable or illegible is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive faster than 30 km/h here?

feedback.metin: This sign only indicates a recommended speed. It is wise to stick to this recommended speed, as the sign is there for a reason. But driving faster, if safe, is not prohibited.

sorular.soru: What is the risk here?
cevaplar: That you cannot see when the traffic light turns green.
That the lorry may roll backwards and collide with your vehicle.
That the exhaust fumes from the lorry enter your vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the lorry may roll backwards and collide with your vehicle.

feedback.metin: If you drive this closely behind a lorry on an uphill slope, there is a risk of the lorry rolling into your vehicle before driving away. It is always wise to maintain sufficient distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, even when stationary, not only due to the risk of the vehicle in front rolling backwards, but also so that you can pass the vehicle if it is stopped due to a breakdown. In addition, the lorry driver cannot see you in this scenario. The fact that you are unable to see when the traffic light turns green does not pose any danger. The exhaust fumes coming from the lorry are not emanating in a way that affects you.

sorular.soru: When should you indicate right here?
cevaplar: As soon as you enter the roundabout.
Just before you exit the roundabout.

feedback.metin: If you are approaching a roundabout and intend to turn right, indicate right well in advance of joining the roundabout. This gives other drivers the chance to anticipate your actions. Drivers coming from the first exit, in particular, will benefit from this.

sorular.soru: Can you stop your car here to quickly unload a parcel?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park your car on the carriageway next to another vehicle, known as double parking. However, you can stop for a moment to load or unload goods or pick up or drop off passengers. You may not use hazard lights while stopped in this case, as they may only be used in emergencies. You may not unnecessarily obstruct or endanger other traffic while parking.

sorular.soru: Must drivers follow all instructions given by a competent and recognisable crossing patrol (lollipop man or lady)?
cevaplar: No. They are only allowed to stop drivers.
Yes. Drivers must follow all instructions.
No. This is not mandatory but it is recommended.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. They are only allowed to stop drivers.

feedback.metin: Competent and identifiable lollipop men or ladies are only authorised if they meet a number of requirements. For example, they must be appointed by the mayor and there must be a stipulation as to where and when they may perform their duties. They may only give instructions to stop. In this case, stopping is mandatory. They may not send drivers to another street or give instructions to pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a load that protrudes 1 metre from the front?

feedback.metin: This load is indivisible in its length, which means it can protrude up to 1 metre from the front. The load may also protrude up to 1 metre from the rear and no more than 5 metres from the centre of the rear axle.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: If you want to turn off, you must always give way to traffic going straight on the same road. This also applies to pedestrians.

sorular.soru: You started parking at 1:40 P.M. How do you set your parking disc?
cevaplar: To 3:40 P.M., the time you must leave the parking space at the latest.
To 2 P.M., the rounded up time you started parking.
Exactly 1:40 P.M., rounding up is not allowed.
sorular.dogruCevap: To 2 P.M., the rounded up time you started parking.

feedback.metin: When you park next to a blue line in a parking disc zone, you must set your parking disc to the time you started parking. You are allowed to round up with a maximum of half an hour, to make it easier to set the disc. In this case, you set the disc to 2 P.M., the next full hour.

sorular.soru: How do you mount a baby seat (for age 0+) on a car seat?
cevaplar: Against the direction of travel and with the airbag enabled.
Against the direction of travel and with the airbag disabled.
In the direction of travel and with the airbag disabled.
sorular.dogruCevap: Against the direction of travel and with the airbag disabled.

feedback.metin: Younger children should be transported in a baby seat that is mounted against the direction of travel to provide good head support in the event of a collision. The airbag should always be disabled when using such child seats.

sorular.soru: Can you drive at 100 km/h here?

feedback.metin: You are passing a sign that indicates the end of a recommended speed limit. On ordinary roads outside built-up areas the speed limit is 80 km/h unless signage indicates otherwise.

sorular.soru: Are you in the right position to make a left turn?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a complete one-way street that is closed to all drivers from the other side. You must pre-sort as much at the left-hand side of the carriageway as possible.

sorular.soru: If you are caught in a repeat offence of driving under the influence of alcohol, will additional consequences apply?

feedback.metin: If you are guilty of drinking and driving, you will be punished. Usually, you will be suspended from driving for a certain number of years. If you are caught drinking and driving again, you may receive an extended suspension.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop immediately and check the oil level.
Drive on to a safe stop and check the oil level.
Drive on to a safe stop and refill the engine oil immediately.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately and check the oil level.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, you must stop immediately. It indicates that there is a problem with the oil pressure. If you continue to drive, there is a risk that the entire engine will break down. Check the oil yourself if it is safe to do so. If you are positioned too dangerously for this, for example on the hard shoulder, call the (breakdown) emergency service.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the tram turning off?

feedback.metin: Trams are tied to a fixed track and therefore less manoeuvrable, which is why different rules apply to trams. Regardless of where they are coming from, you must always give way to trams, unless you are on a priority road and the tram is not.

sorular.soru: When are you allowed to continue driving?
cevaplar: When the red lights are out.
sorular.dogruCevap: When the red lights are out.

feedback.metin: This level crossing is secured. When a train is due to pass, the red lights come on, the bell rings and the barriers go down. When the barriers are down, the bell stops ringing. When the train has passed, the barriers go up. After that, the red lights go out, and you may continue your journey.

sorular.soru: What is the allowed length of a passenger car with a trailer?

feedback.metin: A passenger car with a trailer or caravan may not be longer than 18 metres.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a defective left wing mirror?
cevaplar: No. No mirror may be defective.
No. But a defective right wing mirror is allowed.
Yes. But not with a defective right wing mirror.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. No mirror may be defective.

feedback.metin: A passenger car must have a functioning and undamaged left and right wing mirror and rearview mirror.

sorular.soru: Is resetting the arrival time allowed?

feedback.metin: The use of a parking disc is mandatory when parking in parking disc zones. Use of a parking disc is also mandatory when parking in areas marked with a blue line. In this case, your parking disc must be displayed in your vehicle so that it is clearly visible to parking enforcement personnel. You must note the arrival time on the disc upon arriving. You may then park for as long as is indicated on the relevant signage. Amending the arrival time is not allowed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the brommobiel here?

feedback.metin: This sign means motor vehicles are not allowed to overtake each other. Although brommobielen are not categorised as motor vehicles, they are required to follow the same rules. Brommobielen are therefore not allowed to overtake on this road, nor may they be overtaken.

sorular.soru: Should you expect the snorfiets rider to enter the carriageway?

feedback.metin: Sign D-104 indicates where moped riders must enter the carriageway, both inside and outside built-up areas. The snorfiets rider in front of you may continue to ride on the cycle track and will therefore not simply enter the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here?

feedback.metin: The C1 sign indicates a closure in both directions for vehicles, riders, and escorts of draught animals and cattle. The sign underneath indicates that, in this case, the closure applies to lorries and buses only. Passenger cars are therefore allowed on this road.

sorular.soru: Are these pedestrians allowed to walk here?
cevaplar: Yes. Pedestrians can use the full width of the road here.
No. They cannot block the road and must keep to the right.
No. Only large groups walking in a procession may do this.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Pedestrians can use the full width of the road here.

feedback.metin: Pedestrians are entitled to use the full width of roads within erfs. This means these pedestrians are allowed to walk here as they are. While it would be preferable that they keep to the side, they are not obligated to do so.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the disembarking tram passengers?

feedback.metin: You do not have to give way to tram passengers who are disembarking onto a platform or boarding area. If there is no boarding area or platform, you must give way.

sorular.soru: What is the best thing to do on a steep slope?

feedback.metin: If you want to drive up a steep slope, it is wise to shift down to a lower gear. A higher RPM makes better use of the engine’s pulling power, which makes it easier to drive up the slope.

sorular.soru: Should you give the lorry the opportunity to merge out?

feedback.metin: You may only overtake to the right of the block marking if this improves traffic flow. If you overtake on the right here, the lorry will have to stay on the main carriageway for an unnecessarily long time, which will not improve the flow of traffic.
